Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Scrawny \Scraw"ny\, a. [Cf. {Scrannel}.] Meager; thin; rawboned; bony; scranny. [1913 Webster]

scrawny adj 1: having unattractive thinness; "a child with skinny freckled legs"; "a long scrawny neck" [syn: {scraggy}, {skinny}, {underweight}, {weedy}] 2: inferior in size or quality; "scrawny cattle"; "scrubby cut-over pine"; "old stunted thorn trees" [syn: {scrubby}, {stunted}] [also: {scrawniest}, {scrawnier}]
